# Module 11: External Memory

It's the same hierarchy as CS251.

Now, we should revisit the ADTs to minimize page loads.

![6c1ac6e7.png](6c1ac6e7-kl2ssw8e.png)

Trees have poor memory locality: in the access of $m$ nodes, then it must load $m$ spaced out memory locations.

## 2-3 trees

The basic idea is to allow more than 1 kvp per node. These trees are always balanced!

1 nodes behave exactly like BSTs. 2-nodes have 3 children, 1 branch for less than both, 1 branch for between or equal to the two keys, and 1 branch for greater than both.

The leaves are nil, and aren't counted to the height.

![051dd631.png](051dd631-kl2ssw8e.png)
